cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles west of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting south-to-southeast over the east-central Gulf of Mexico and gradually weakening, remaining well west of the Florida Peninsula.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – system expected to remain over open Gulf waters and degenerate before any land interaction
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: 0 (storm center already far offshore relative to PortMiami)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Gulf of Mexico waters southward toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at PortMiami; local winds remain below 34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected given large offshore distance and weakening storm.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 1–2 inches with localized amounts up to 5 inches through Saturday; could cause isolated urban/flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief localized flooding of low-lying/poor-drainage areas from heavy downpours.
